I mean, I kinda had an epiphany as a senior
in high school,

1421.02.text:
and just realized how silly it all is, the
whole façade.

1425.66.text:
You know, even in high school, I think there's
just

1427.96.text:
so much of it that's just built on image and
expectation from the clothes that we think

1433.11.text:
we need to wear or
buy.

1434.72.text:
And I would go to school and look around,
and realize that these are the same kids that

1438.93.text:
I grew up
with since I was like, so little, and half

1442.77.text:
the time walking around in school, we're not
even smiling at each

1445.99.text:
other or saying hi or engaging, 'cause we're
all so afraid of just not fitting in.

1451.67.text:
We're all so like,
conditioned to be going through these motions

1459.07.text: of acting how we think we're supposed to act.

1462.35.text:
Everything
gets so based on image around your peers at

1466.14.text:
that age that even just something like showing
kindness,

1469.16.text: saying hello, those things get forgotten.

1472.54.text:
We all do crave human connection, we all crave
being accepted

1477.67.text:
and connection, but we look for it in ways
that maybe aren't really the true connection

1482.73.text:
of it, and that life's
too short to live like that.

1487.00.text:
I mean, still, once you see the truth, you
can't un-see it, and so, it is something

1492.21.text:
that does just help keep me in line, and how
important it is to really just know that as

1501.61.text:
long as you're
trying your best in life, you're giving love

1509.92.text:
Then give yourself a hand and just, you
know, love yourself, and let all the critics

1516.09.text:
and all the insecurities fall away, because
you're doing a good

1522.91.text:
Kimi Werner sees her way to happiness and
can't un-see that, either.

1527.61.text:
Mahalo to Kimi Werner,
currently in 2016 a resident of Waialua, Oahu,

1532.94.text: for sharing your stories with us.

1535.42.text:
And thank you, for
joining us.

1537.76.text:
For PBS Hawaii and Long Story Short, I'm Leslie
Wilcox.

1543.12.text:
For audio and written transcripts of all episodes
of Long Story Short with Leslie Wilcox, visit

1553.20.text:
To download free podcasts of Long Story Short
with Leslie Wilcox, go to the

1557.78.text: Apple iTunes Store or visit PBSHawaii.org.

1562.27.text:
Do you see this career as extending over a
long time?

1570.60.text:
I never really knew where any of this was
going, whether it was art or spearfishing,

1577.23.text: I've never been like, the ten-year plan girl.

1579.44.text: I've been like, can I pay my rent this month?

1583.66.text: That's great; you're doing awesome in life.

1586.80.text:
And now, it has become something that I can
find a lot more

1591.95.text:
comfort in, and I understand that because
I'm making decisions that are truthfully,

1600.94.text:
you know, holding true
to my values, that's what's making it long-lasting.
